item.title: Ticket #1555 (quicktags don't work as of rev 2748) created
item.dc:creator: billimek
item.description:
The rev. 2748 change to edit-form-advanced.php moved the 'edCanvas = document.getElementById('content');' script call to a place before the actual definition of the 'content' textarea.

When this happened, 'quicktag' functions no longer seem to be able to function correctly - i.e. they don't affect anything in the 'content' textarea.

item.description: The TinyMCE rich editor component doesn't work for me: I can't edit text inside it. I'm using Firefox 1.0.6

duplicate:

duplicate of #1553

item.title: fix-glob.diff attached to Ticket #1553
item.dc:creator: davidhouse

item.title: Ticket #1553 (Presentation page forces screenshots to be PNG) created
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description:
According to Matt's email to wp-hackers [1], the plan is to allow screenshots with extensions of .png, .gif or .jpg. At the moment, only .png is allowed. This is due to a typo in the glob() call. Patch attached.

[1]: â€‹http://comox.textdrive.com/pipermail/wp-hackers/2005-August/002266.html

item.title: Ticket #1536 (mysql errors with wp-mail after upgrade to 1.5.1.3 from 1.5.1.2) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
Keywords, Owner, Status, Severity, Milestone changed

It would seem that the data isn't being properly escaped. This is also a potential security hole.

Either explicitly escaping the content, or adding this should fix it: 

add_filter('phone_content', 'addslashes');

Might be a good time to review the other fields being posted, to see if any of them are a potential security risk.

item.title: Ticket #1550 (Improve l10n stuff) updated
item.dc:creator: whimboo
item.description:
Status changed

There are some issues left. First, no sticky bit is available to fetch the current locale during the next load of a page. Should a cookie be used for?

The additionally functions load_plugin_textdomain and load_theme_textdomain won't work when the locale was set before. Due to $l10n[$domain] still exists loading is aborted. That has to be changed so new entries will be appended to the hash.

item.title: 1550.diff attached to Ticket #1550
item.dc:creator: whimboo
item.description: Patch

item.title: Ticket #1550 (Improve l10n stuff) created
item.dc:creator: whimboo
item.description:
The use of dynamically switching locales in wordpress seems to be really impossible currently.

I improved the handling by changing a lot of the wp-l10n.php content. The biggest issues were the handling of the default domain. Why a locale 'default' is used by different functions? There are locale id's which should be used! Otherwise localization won't really work.

Further I added a function set_locale which allows to set a locale directly. It checks if %locale%.mo is already loaded. If not the file will be loaded and the locale is set immediately if loading was successful.

With the patch it's possible to activate another language by simply calling set_locale('%locale_id%'). This will offer a way to let the user select his prefered language with e.g. the help of a drowndown box.

Patch is upcoming.
